enhanced_by.reason: The hex method relies on the nextRandomBytes method to generate random bytes, which are then converted to a hexadecimal string.
The hex(int) method shares the same input pattern (length) with the hex(int, boolean) method, making it useful for setting up similar test cases.
The hex(int) method produces a hexadecimal string similar to the hex(int, boolean) method, making it useful for constructing assertions.
The hex method transforms the output of nextRandomBytes into a hexadecimal string, making it useful for verifying the transformation logic.
